required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Different Doses of Venus Association in Patients With Vulvovaginal Candidiasis.
clinical_study.official_title: National, Multicenter, Randomized, Double-blind, Phase II Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Different Doses of Venus Association in Patients With Vulvovaginal Candidiasis

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of different doses of Venus association in the treatment of vulvovaginal candidiasis.

primary_outcome.measure: Time to first relief of symptoms
primary_outcome.description: Time to obtain moderate relief of at least one of the evaluated symptoms (itching, irritation or burning) after the application of the medication.

secondary_outcome.description: Incidence and severity of adverse events recorded during the study.

arm_group.description: Venus association vaginal cream, single dose.
Venus association vaginal cream, single dose.
Venus association vaginal cream, single dose.
Butoconazole nitrate vaginal cream, single-dose containing 100 mg.

intervention.description: Butoconazole nitrate vaginal cream, 100 mg single-dose.
